page.title: 11FUTURE OF THE RIVER GANNEL
page.content: {Damming the River Gannel}Many hotel owners want to dam the Gannel to attract more holiday makers. They have arranged to pay for a feasibility study to see if it is possible. By flooding the estuary a lake will form so that windsurfers and small boats can sail there. A dam is a huge, water-retaining wall and hoteliers hope that cars will be able to drive round the lake and over the dam. 70% of the people we spoke to were very much against the dam because the lake will cover a famous area of saltings with special plants and wildlife which conservationists wish to keep. The scheme is also expensive and local people do not want to pay for it. A lot of residents have made their views known to the Local Councils and the Cornish Press.
